content:
----- TEN CODES ----- 10-1 -- Roll Call 10-2 -- Arriving At Scene 10-3 -- Negative 10-4 -- Affirmative 10-5 -- Repeat 10-6 -- Stand By 10-7 -- Report TO [LOCATION] 10-8 -- Suspect Lost 10-9 -- Suspect Arrested 10-10 -- Activity Update (Status Update + 10-20 + 10-11 ) 10-11 -- Police Operation 10-12 -- Requesting Backup 10-13 -- Officer Down 10-17 -- Description 10-18 -- MDC Check 10-20 -- Location 10-21 -- Be on Lookout ( Description ) 10-22 -- Disregard Last Statement 10-27 -- Suspicious Activity ( Gang Violence / Weapon / Drug Deal ) 10-28 -- Radio Silence 10-29 -- Radio Silence Lifted 10-30 -- Returning to Patrol ( City Wide ) 10-31 -- Returning to the Police Station 10-32 -- No need for Further Assistance 10-50 -- Car Crash 10-55 -- Traffic Stop 10-57 Victor -- Vehicle Pursuit 10-57 Foxtrot -- Foot Pursuit 10-99 -- Assignment Completed ( State Condition : Arrested, Ticketed etc )
----- RESPONSE/JOB CODES ----- Code 1 -- Routine Call (No lights or sirens) Code 2 -- Priority Call (No Lights or sirens) Code 3 -- Emergency Call (Lights and sirens)
----- STATUS CODES ----- Status 1 -- On Duty Status 2 -- Off Duty Status 3 -- Inactive - Meal break , vehicle fill up etc
----- IDENTITY CODES ----- IC1 – White person, northern European type IC2 – Mediterranean European/Hispanic IC3 – African/Afro-Caribbean person IC4 – Indian, Pakistani, Nepalese, Maldivian, Sri Lankan, Bangladeshi, or any other (South) Asian person IC5 – Chinese, Japanese, or South-East Asian person
